info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Showers and Thunderstorms with Heavy Rain through 2 PM... At 1224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking several heavy showers and thunderstorms, one of which was near Holley and Albion, moving east at 25 mph. This activity will produce one hour rainfall amounts of an inch and a half in some areas resulting significant ponding on area roadways and possibly some poor drainage flooding. Since the storms may move over the same area, higher rainfall amounts will be possible. HAZARD...Heavy rain and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, Brockport, Medina, Albion, Hilton, Webster, Brighton, Hamlin Beach State Park, Gates-North Gates, Penfield, Spencerport, Holley, Waterport, Lakeside Beach State Park, Point Breeze, Kent, Ridgeway and Shelby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
